intro: Anisochilus carnosus var. viridis, commonly known as the green anisochilus, is a variant of the anisochilus plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically green in color, though they may exhibit varying shades depending on environmental conditions. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique leaf structure. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate to bright indirect light for optimal growth. The leaves are not only visually appealing but also serve as water storage organs, aiding the plant in surviving in arid conditions.
